sen.j: 中 天游（なか てんゆう、男性、天明3年（1783年） - 天保6年3月26日 (旧暦)（1835年4月23日））は日本の蘭方医、蘭学者。
sen.e: Tenyu NAKA (male, 1783 - April 23, 1835) was a Doctor of Dutch medicine and Dutch scholar.
Tenyu NAKA (male, 1783 - April 23, 1835) was a Doctor of Dutch medicine and Dutch scholar.
Tenyu NAKA (male, 1783 - April 23, 1835) was a Doctor of Dutch medicine and Dutch scholar.

sen.j: 名は環（たまき）、耕助（こうすけ）、融（とおる）。
sen.e: His name were Tamaki, Kosuke and Toru.
His names were Tamaki, Kosuke and Toru.
sen.cmt: His name were→His names wereとしました。
sen.e: His names were Tamaki, Kosuke and Toru.

sen.j: 字は環中（かんちゅう）。
sen.e: Azana (adult males nickname) was Kanchu.
Azana (adult males nickname) was Kanchu.
Azana (adult males nickname) was Kanchu.

sen.j: 号 (称号)は天游（てんゆう）、思思斎、思々斎（ししさい）
sen.e: His second name or alias were Tenyu, Shishisai (思思斎 or 思々斎).
His second names or aliases were Tenyu, Shishisai (思思斎 or 思々斎).
sen.cmt: His second name or alias were→His second names or aliases wereとしました。
sen.e: His second names or aliases were Tenyu, Shishisai (思思斎 or 思々斎).

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: 天游は丹後国に生まれる。
sen.e: Tenyu was born in Tango Province.
Tenyu was born in Tango Province.
Tenyu was born in Tango Province.

sen.j: 父は儒医上田河陽、のちに母方の親戚、中家の跡継ぎとして養子に出される。
sen.e: His father was a Confucian and a doctor (concurrent), 上田河陽, and later, he put Tenyu up for adoption as an successor of a relative on the mother's side, nakaya.
His father was a Confucian and a doctor (concurrent), 上田河陽, and later, he put Tenyu up for adoption as an successor of a relative on his mother's side, the Naka family.
sen.cmt: on the mother's side→on his mother's sideとし、nakaya→the Naka familyに修正
sen.e: His father was a Confucian and a doctor (concurrent), 上田河陽, and later, he put Tenyu up for adoption as an successor of a relative on his mother's side, the Naka family.

sen.j: 22歳の時に江戸に出て大槻玄沢の私塾・芝蘭堂に入門、のちに京都府に移り住んだ芝蘭堂四天王の一人、稲村三伯を追って師事し蘭学や蘭方医学を学んだ。
sen.e: At the age of 22, he went to Edo to enter Gentaku Otsuki's private school called Shiran-do, and after that, he followed one of the best four of Shiran-do, Sanpaku INAMURA who moved to Kyoto, and studied Western learning and Western medical science under him.

At the age of 22, he went to Edo to enter Gentaku OTSUKI's private school called Shiran-do, and after that, he followed one of the best four of Shiran-do, Sanpaku INAMURA who moved to Kyoto, and studied Western learning and Western medical science under him.

At the age of 22, he went to Edo to enter Gentaku OTSUKI's private school called Shiran-do, and after that, he followed one of the best four of Shiran-do, Sanpaku INAMURA who moved to Kyoto, and studied Western learning and Western medical science under him.

sen.j: 師の三伯が病に伏すと天游はその才を買われ三伯の娘さだと結婚。
sen.e: When his teacher Sanpaku became sick, Tenyu who was appreciated by Sanpaku got married with his daughter, Sada.
When his teacher Sanpaku became sick, Tenyu who was appreciated by Sanpaku got married with his daughter, Sada.
When his teacher Sanpaku became sick, Tenyu who was appreciated by Sanpaku got married with his daughter, Sada.

sen.j: 三伯の死後は、大阪府に移り妻と医所を開いて町医者となった。
sen.e: After the death of Sanpaku, Tenyu moved to Osaka with his wife to open clinic and became a medical practitioner.
After the death of Sanpaku, Tenyu moved to Osaka with his wife to open clinic and became a medical practitioner.
After the death of Sanpaku, Tenyu moved to Osaka with his wife to open clinic and became a medical practitioner.

sen.j: しかし天游は医学より究理学（科学・自然哲学）などのほうを好んだ。
sen.e: However, Tenyu prefer Kyurigaku, philosophy of nature (science, natural philosophy) rather than medical science.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, Tenyu preferred Kyurigaku, philosophy of nature (science, natural philosophy) rather than medical science.
sen.cmt: prefer→preferredに修正、余分なスペース消去
sen.e: However, Tenyu preferred Kyurigaku, philosophy of nature (science, natural philosophy) rather than medical science.

sen.j: 医所は妻に任せきりで蘭学に熱中していた。
sen.e: While he left management of the clinic to his wife, he became involved in Western learning.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While he left management of the clinic to his wife, he became involved in Western learning.
While he left management of the clinic to his wife, he became involved in Western learning.

sen.j: その後、大坂に芝蘭堂四天王橋本宗吉が開いた私塾・絲漢堂の噂を聞くとその門を叩いた。
sen.e: After that, when Tenyu heard the reputation about private school Shikan-do which was founded by one of the best four of Shiran-do, Sokichi HASHIMOTO, he became a pupil of Sokichi HASHIMOTO.
After that, when Tenyu heard the reputation about private school Shikan-do founded by one of the best four of Shiran-do, Sokichi HASHIMOTO, he became a pupil of Sokichi HASHIMOTO.
After that, when Tenyu heard the reputation about private school Shikan-do founded by one of the best four of Shiran-do, Sokichi HASHIMOTO, he became a pupil of Sokichi HASHIMOTO.

sen.j: 蘭学は蛮学（野蛮な学問）と蔑まれた時代、蘭学者への風当たりは酷い。
sen.e: At a time when Western learning was held in contempt as bangaku (barbaric study), public opinion was strongly against Dutch scholars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At a time when Western learning was held in contempt as bangaku (barbaric study), public opinion was strongly against Dutch scholars.
At a time when Western learning was held in contempt as bangaku (barbaric study), public opinion was strongly against Dutch scholars.

sen.j: 大坂切支丹一件、シーボルト事件を契機に弾圧が厳しくなり、師の宗吉も塾を閉鎖して一時隠棲するが、天游は大坂蘭学の灯を消さぬため公儀と対峙し続けた。
sen.e: With the Osaka Kirisitan Incident and Siebold Incident as a start, the crackdown toward Dutch scholars was becoming more violent, and Tenyu's teacher, Sokichi also closed the school and lived in seclusion temporarily, however, Tenyu continued to be confronted with an opposition in order to hand on the torch of Western learning in Osaka in unbroke transmission down the ages.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the Osaka Kirisitan Incident and Siebold Incident as a start, the crackdown toward Dutch scholars was becoming more violent, and Tenyu's teacher, Sokichi also closed the school and lived in seclusion temporarily, however, Tenyu continued to be confronted with an opposition in order to hand on the torch of Western learning in Osaka in unbroke transmission down the ages.

With the Osaka Kirisitan Incident and Siebold Incident as a start, the crackdown toward Dutch scholars was becoming more violent, and Tenyu's teacher, Sokichi also closed the school and lived in seclusion temporarily, however, Tenyu continued to be confronted with an opposition in order to hand on the torch of Western learning in Osaka in unbroke transmission down the ages.

sen.j: 天保3年（1832年）、天保の大飢饉が発生するとその対策に尽力したが、その最中の天保6年（1835年）3月26日死去。
sen.e: When the Tempo Famine occurred in 1823, he worked hard to it, however, he died on March 26, 1835, in the middle of the famine.
When the Tempo Famine occurred in 1832, he worked hard to it, however, he died on April 23, 1835, in the middle of the famine.
When the Tempo Famine occurred in 1832, he worked hard to it, however, he died on April 23, 1835, in the middle of the famine.

sen.j: 享年53。
sen.e: He died at the age of 53.
He died at the age of 53.
He died at the age of 53.

sen.j: 橋本宗吉は大坂の地に蘭学を根付かせようと奔走し大坂蘭学の祖と言われたが、天游もまた宗吉と共に大坂蘭学を盛り立てた人物の一人として後世に名を残した。
sen.e: Sokichi HASAHIMOTO, who made a great effort to allow Western learning to take root in the land of OSAKA, was called founder of Western learning, while Tenyu also earned his place in history with Sokichi as one of the person who livened up Western learning in Osaka.

Sokichi HASHIMOTO, who made a great effort to allow Western learning to take root in the land of OSAKA, was called the founder of Western learning, while Tenyu also earned his place in history with Sokichi as one of the person who livened up Western learning in Osaka.
sen.cmt: HASAHIMOTO→HASHIMOTOに修正、founder→the founderとしました。
sen.e: Sokichi HASHIMOTO, who made a great effort to allow Western learning to take root in the land of OSAKA, was called the founder of Western learning, while Tenyu also earned his place in history with Sokichi as one of the person who livened up Western learning in Osaka.

sen.j: さらに、自らも絲漢堂で学ぶかたわら35歳で私塾・思々斎塾を開き、緒方洪庵、億川百記らを輩出。
sen.e: Moreover, besides learning at Shikan-do, he founded a private school, Shishisaijuku, at the age of 35, and produced Koan OGATA and Hyakki OKUGAWA and others.
Moreover, besides learning at Shikan-do, he founded a private school, Shishisaijuku, at the age of 35, and produced Koan OGATA and Hyakki OKUGAWA and others.
Moreover, besides learning at Shikan-do, he founded a private school, Shishisaijuku, at the age of 35, and produced Koan OGATA and Hyakki OKUGAWA and others.

sen.j: 天游の死後、その遺志を継いだ洪庵の代には江戸蘭学を越え日本一の蘭学の地として大坂蘭学は栄えることになった。
sen.e: After the death of Tenyu, in Koan's time, who followed the last wishes of Tenyu, Western learning in Osaka exceeded that in Edo and prospered as the most popular place of of Western learning in Japan.
After the death of Tenyu, in Koan's time, who followed the last wishes of Tenyu, Western learning in Osaka exceeded that in Edo and prospered as the most popular place of Western learning in Japan.
After the death of Tenyu, in Koan's time, who followed the last wishes of Tenyu, Western learning in Osaka exceeded that in Edo and prospered as the most popular place of Western learning in Japan.

sen.j: また、著作の分野でもイギリスのジョン・ケイルの天文学の著書を志筑忠雄が訳した究理学書「暦象新書」に自身の考えを加筆した書引律を執筆した。
sen.e: Moreover, in the field of literary work, Tenyu wrote 書引律 by adding his opinion to the book of astronomy (the book of Kyurigaku) titled "Rekishoshinsho" written by John Kane and translated by Tadao SHITSUKI.
sen.cmt: 書引律の読み方および意味不明 一原文一訳文の例外対処 ジョン・ケインの正確なスペルがわかりませんでした
sen.e: Moreover, in the field of literary work, Tenyu wrote the book Inritsu (引律) by adding his opinion to the book of astronomy (the book of Kyurigaku) titled 'Rekishoshinsho' written by John KEIL and translated by Tadao SHITSUKI.
sen.cmt: 書引律→"書「引律」"と思われます。読み不明のため、the book Inritsu (引律)としました。Jone Kane→John KEILに修正 (参照: http://library.nao.ac.jp/kichou/open/004/index.html)シングルクォーテーションに変更
sen.e: Moreover, in the field of literary work, Tenyu wrote the book Inritsu (引律) by adding his opinion to the book of astronomy (the book of Kyurigaku) titled 'Rekishoshinsho' written by John KEIL and translated by Tadao SHITSUKI.

sen.j: 和算にも通じ医学に偏りがちだった日本の西洋学問に新たな分野を開拓し多くの著作を残した。
sen.e: Tenyu, who was also well versed in Wasan (Japanese mathematics), pioneered a new field in Western learning that tended to place a disproportionate emphasis on medical science and left many literary works.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tenyu, who was also well versed in Wasan (Japanese mathematics), pioneered a new field in Western learning that tended to place a disproportionate emphasis on medical science and left many literary works.

Tenyu, who was also well versed in Wasan (Japanese mathematics), pioneered a new field in Western learning that tended to place a disproportionate emphasis on medical science and left many literary works.
